role: Head of Commissioning, Natural History and Science
name: Jack Bootle
background: Jack Bootle serves as Head of Commissioning, Natural History and Science at BBC. Focus areas: Natural history, science, specialist factual. They are looking for: Innovative natural history storytelling; science that makes complex topics accessible; landmark series with international appeal. Overall network strategy: The BBC seeks distinctive, authored documentary and specialist factual content that offers depth, intelligence and fresh perspectives while reflecting the diversity of UK audiences.
thematic_priorities: Natural history programming with innovative visual approaches and storytelling techniques
Science programming that makes complex topics accessible without oversimplification
History documentaries that connect past events to contemporary issues
Arts programming that celebrates British cultural excellence
Religion and ethics documentaries exploring faith in the modern world
target_audience: Broad UK audiences across BBC channels and iPlayer
budget_parameters: Documentary: £150K–£350K per hour; Specialist Factual: £180K–£350K per hour
technical_requirements: Broadcast/streaming standards; details provided upon commissioning
Subtitles/captions; audio description per broadcaster requirements
current_calls: Reflect latest broadcaster priorities as outlined above; commissioner-specific interests included.
submission_process: One-page outline with premise, format, and episode breakdown
Details of secured or potential access
Key talent and production team credentials
additional_info: Increasing focus on distinctive voices and cross-platform reach; Emphasis on diverse voices on- and off-screen; Encouragement of sustainable production practices; Support for projects across the UK (where applicable); Open to pitches from independent producers/companies
